data.text: One time, I set up camp in what I thought was a normal forest. I woke up in the middle of the night to the loud noise of gunshots. I was shitting my pants. I could hear people from a distance, and what I assume was laughs, and more gunshots. I sat and started to pack, my intention was to leave asap. Were they drunk? Did they see me set camp earlier? Were they coming for me? Crazy thoughts ran in my mind. While packing everything frenetically, I suddenly stopped, thinking about how my movements would catch their attention. Or maybe they'd think I am an animal and they'd shoot right away. I froze. I still remember the feeling in my veins, I had never experienced fear like this before in my life. I found myself stuck in that situation, not moving, not making any noise, for what felt like forever. Worse night. I guess I fell asleep at some point, because the birds singing woke me up. I packed up and left pretty quickly, thanking the universe I was still alive. Biking away, I saw an orange and white sign down the road: "Zona de ca√ßa" (hunting zone). Man oh man, never will I make that mistake again! ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Long story short: sometimes leaving ain't an option üòÖ

data.text: Find a park, a small patch of trees, a football field, cover of some kind and make a shelter or set up for a cowboy camp. Stealth camping is fine if you don't poo everywhere, don't light fires, get there after dark, set up quietly, have a sleep and wake up with the sun, get packed and on the road again before anyone's the wiser. Even if you get busted, if you're being discreet and not leaving crap lying around all over the place, a lot of people will turn a blind eye.
